reasoning: Werner syndrome is an extremely rare autosomal recessive progeroid disorder. Prevalence estimated at 1-9 per million, translating to incidence <0.01 per 100k. Higher prevalence in Japan (~1 in 50,000) due to founder effect.
source: Oshima J et al. (2017). Werner syndrome: Clinical features, pathogenesis and potential therapeutic interventions. Ageing Res Rev. 33:105-114
